alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 26 at 3:52PM AKST until March 01 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations 12 to 24 inches with localized higher amounts is possible. East winds gusting as high as 20 to 35 mph, strongest through Portage Valley and eastern Turnagain Arm, could produce white out conditions at times. * WHERE...Western Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are expected in Whittier, Portage Valley and east Turnagain Arm due to the combination of heavy snow and blowing snow. However, all areas will likely see significant snow accumulation. There is uncertainty in when the snow will end, ranging anywhere from Wednesday morning to Wednesday evening. This will impact the amount of snow accumulation.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
